page.title: 09CHURCH AND RELIGION.
page.content: The churches in the area are: 2 established,1 Roman Catholic,1 United Reformed and 1 Methodist. There still exists a fairly deep conservative Protestantism among the indigenous population.This religious attitude is for the most part not articulated and can be traced back to Cromwell's time.Suffolk was one of the recruiting grounds for his army,and many churches still bear the marks of his reforming zeal. With the influx of large numbers of people retiring to this area or buying properties for holiday homes, this attitude is balanced by the attitudes of the mostly "urban" churches from which they come."Church" provides a basis of security and strength.Most Church attenders are elderly and resist changes in patterns of worship.
